events.originalText: A landslide at a jade mine in Hpakant killed 175-200 miners, the deadliest mining accident in Burmese history.
events.subtitle: 2020 Hpakant jade mine disaster
events.headline: Deadliest mining accident in Burmese history: 175-200 miners killed in Hpakant landslide

events.originalText: A Mw 6.1 strike-slip earthquake killed at least 35 people and injured 276 others in the Indonesian province of Aceh on the northern end of Sumatra.
events.subtitle: 2013 Aceh earthquake
events.headline: Mw 6.1 earthquake in Aceh, Indonesia: 35 dead, 276 injured

events.originalText: The International Astronomical Union announced that the fourth and fifth moons of Pluto to be discovered would be named Kerberos and Styx, respectively.
events.subtitle: International Astronomical Union
events.headline: Pluto's moons named Kerberos and Styx by International Astronomical Union

events.originalText: Israeli–Palestinian conflict: An Arab man rammed a loader into traffic in Jerusalem, killing three people and injuring 40 others (damage pictured).
events.subtitle: Israeli–Palestinian conflict
events.headline: Jerusalem attack: Arab man kills three, injures 40 in loader rampage

events.originalText: More than a year after the end of the Vietnam War, North and South Vietnam officially merged under communist rule to form the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: North and South Vietnam merge under communist rule

events.originalText: U.S. president Lyndon B. Johnson signed the Civil Rights Act into law, outlawing segregation in schools, at the workplace, and other facilities that served the general public.
events.subtitle: Lyndon B. Johnson
events.headline: Civil Rights Act signed by U.S. president Lyndon B. Johnson

events.originalText: A German SS unit arrived in Vilnius, Lithuania, and began the systematic execution of up to 100,000 people over the next three years.
events.subtitle: Schutzstaffel
events.headline: German SS unit begins systematic execution in Vilnius, Lithuania

events.originalText: Amidst weeks of race riots in East St. Louis, Illinois, white residents burned sections of the city and shot black inhabitants as they escaped the flames.
events.subtitle: East St. Louis massacre
events.headline: Race riots in East St. Louis: White residents burn city, shoot black inhabitants

events.originalText: The U.S. Congress passed the Sherman Antitrust Act, the first United States government action to limit monopolies.
events.subtitle: United States Congress
events.headline: U.S. Congress passes Sherman Antitrust Act to limit monopolies

events.originalText: U.S. president James A. Garfield was fatally shot at the Baltimore and Potomac Railroad station in Washington, D.C.
events.subtitle: James A. Garfield
events.headline: U.S. president James A. Garfield fatally shot in Washington, D.C.

events.originalText: The French frigate Méduse ran aground off the coast of present-day Mauritania, with the survivors escaping on a makeshift raft, depicted in Théodore Géricault's painting The Raft of the Medusa (pictured).
events.subtitle: French frigate Méduse (1810)
events.headline: French frigate Méduse runs aground off Mauritania coast

events.originalText: First English Civil War: The combined forces of Scottish Covenanters and English Parliamentarians defeated Royalist troops at the Battle of Marston Moor.
events.subtitle: First English Civil War
events.headline: Battle of Marston Moor: Covenanters and Parliamentarians defeat Royalist troops

events.originalText: The bodies of Emperor Gaozong of Tang and Empress Wu Zetian were interred in the Qianling Mausoleum.
events.subtitle: Emperor Gaozong of Tang
events.headline: Emperor Gaozong and Empress Wu Zetian interred in Qianling Mausoleum

events.originalText: During the Xuanwu Gate Incident, Prince Li Shimin led his forces to assassinate his rival brothers in a coup for the imperial throne of the Tang dynasty.
events.subtitle: Xuanwu Gate Incident
events.headline: Prince Li Shimin leads coup for Tang dynasty throne in Xuanwu Gate Incident
